item.title: Paris Attacks Spur Emergency Edict and Intense Policing in France
item.description: With expanded police powers extended for three more months, some, particularly Muslims, question whether the loss of liberties is appropriate.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:credit: Francis Pellier/French Ministry of Interior, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Security forces during a raid in Saint-Denis, north of Paris, last week. The French Parliament voted last week to extend the state of emergency for three more months.

item.title: Iranian Hackers Attack State Dept. via Social Media Accounts
item.description: American officials say cyberespionage is becoming a tool to obtain the influence that many in Iran hoped the nuclear program would give the country.
item.dc:creator: DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, second from left, with members of the American delegation in Vienna during nuclear talks with Iran in July. Over the past month, Iranian hackers identified individual State Department officials who focus on Iran and the Middle East and broke into their email and social media accounts.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu Plans Separate Bypass Roads for Israelis in Parts of West Bank
item.description: The prime minister said Israeli drivers would be able to bypass certain intersections in the occupied West Bank, where an Israeli soldier was killed in the latest spate of attacks by Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers on Monday near the body of a Palestinian man who was shot dead after fatally stabbing an Israeli soldier, Pvt. Ziv Mizrachi, at a gas station on a highway in the West Bank.

item.title: Turkey Shoots Down Russian Warplane Near Syrian Border
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia confirmed that an F-16 Turkish fighter jet brought down a Russian aircraft that he said had remained in Syrian airspace.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: François Hollande Meeting With Obama on ISIS Strategy
item.description: The French president was arriving in Washington just over 10 days after Islamist terrorists staged attacks in Paris.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER

item.title: Letter From America: In Arguments Over Terrorism, Echoes of World War II
item.description: Seven decades on, it is remarkable how many of our political arguments continue to focus on the resistance of Nazi-like behavior, whether in ourselves or others.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANAND GIRIDHARADAS
item.media:description: Heavy security remained in Paris after the Nov. 13 attacks.

item.title: Athens Blast Hurts None but Fuels Fears of Domestic Terrorism
item.description: The explosion outside the offices of a business federation in the heart of the city was the first such attack under Greece’s leftist-led government.
item.dc:creator: NIKI KITSANTONIS
item.media:description: Forensic experts searched for evidence outside an Athens office building after a bomb exploded early Tuesday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Hollande’s War on Liberties
item.description: An outcry rising in France likens the president’s proposals to a “Patriot Act à la française.”
item.dc:creator: SYLVAIN CYPEL

item.title: Sinosphere: Chinese Student Protesting Books’ Stance on Homosexuality Meets With Officials
item.description: Chen Qiuyan, who pressed for the removal of materials that call homosexuality an affliction, had a meeting with two education officials that lasted an hour and ended without an agreement.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Chen Qiuyan, second from right, also known as Qiu Bai, and other activists holding signs that read “Educational materials must be right, homosexuals must be seen,” “Support justice,” “Refuse to use education materials that contain erroneous information about homosexuality” and “We're together with Qiu Bai” outside a court in Beijing on Tuesday.

item.title: Militants Attack Hotel in North Sinai Peninsula of Egypt, Killing at Least 3
item.description: There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the assault at the Swiss Inn Resort in El Arish, which was housing judges who were monitoring voting in parliamentary elections.
item.category: Sinai Province of the Islamic State
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: John Bolton: To Defeat ISIS, Create a Sunni State
item.description: Putting Syria and Iraq back together will serve only the interests of Moscow and Tehran.
item.dc:creator: JOHN R. BOLTON

item.title: Islamabad Journal: A Storied Bookstore and Its Late Oracle Leave an Imprint on Islamabad
item.description: Saeed Jan Qureshi built one of the biggest bookstores in the world and earned a reputation as a source of literary advice. Now, the future of Saeed Book Bank is in his son’s hands.
item.dc:creator: ROD NORDLAND
item.media:credit: Danial Shah for The New York Times
item.media:description: Saeed Book Bank is an institution in Islamabad, displaying 200,000 titles, mostly in English, and stocking more than four million books in its five warehouses.

item.title: Turkey Shoots Down Military Plane Near Syria Border
item.description: Officials were trying to find out the origin of the aircraft, which was shot down by F-16 jets after violating Turkish airspace on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU
item.media:credit: Fatih Akta/Anadolu Agency, via Getty Images
item.media:description: A military plane in flames after being shot down by Turkish fighter jets near to the Syrian border on Tuesday.

item.title: Paris Victims, Remembered
item.description: At least 130 people were killed Nov. 13. They included an architect, an Algerian violinist, an American college student and many, many music fans. Here are some of their stories.

item.title: Investigation Into Emissions to Take Months, VW Chief Says
item.description: Matthias Müller, VW’s chief executive, also said bringing diesel vehicles into compliance with regulations would be less costly than feared.
item.dc:creator: JACK EWING
item.media:description: Matthias Mueller, chief executive of Volkswagen, said the carmaker is several months away from clarifying who was responsible for the emissions-cheating software.

item.title: Extreme Weather Tied to Over 600,000 Deaths Over 2 Decades
item.description: A week before a climate meeting in Paris, the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction warned that the frequency of such events was expected to rise.
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
item.media:description: Destroyed houses after a mudslide caused by Tropical Storm Erika in Montrouis, Haiti, in August.

item.title: World Briefing: Dominican Republic: Warrants Seek Frenchmen in ‘Air Cocaine’ Escape
item.description: The warrants sought the arrests of three French citizens who allegedly helped a pair of French pilots convicted on cocaine trafficking charges flee by speedboat in October.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Egypt: Forces Kill 5 Sudanese at Border
item.description: The deaths came eight days after Egyptian border guards were accused in the fatal shootings of at least 15 Sudanese migrants trying to cross the frontier.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: U.S. Strikes Target ISIS Revenue
item.description: The United States military said Monday that it had destroyed 283 tanker trucks used by Islamic State militants to transport oil out of eastern Syria.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Artist’s Death Sentence Follows a String of Harsh Punishments in Saudi Arabia
item.description: The case of Ashraf Fayadh, who was sentenced to death on charges of apostasy, is one of several that have fueled comparisons between Saudi Arabia and the jihadists of the Islamic State.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD
